ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Hmmm.  Someone else looking at DAoC?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... If you really believe that, good.  Granted, UO was worse, and I hope DAoC is even less exploitable - but the name of the game is profit, and people will
ygData.messageBody:
At 04:47 PM 10/10/2001 +0200, you wrote:
>I dont find the learning curve any worse than in EQ.
>The fact that you cant minimize cant scare me. You couldent do that with EQ
>either.. Well you can, but it requires a 3rd party program..
>Besides when Im playing a game I dont need ot alt tab back and forth to
>other things. And I do agree with Mythic that disabling alt-tab is an easy
>and good way to avoid script kiddies hacking the game... EQ limited hacking
>greatly by what it has done. Just compare it with UO.

If you really believe that, good. Granted, UO was worse, and I hope DAoC
is even less exploitable - but the name of the game is profit, and people
will find a way to profit, any way that they can - even if it means kicking
some guy in the nads and stealing his million-dollar baseball.

There is no substitute for human ingenuity, especially when powered by
jealousy or selfishness.

Talies
